question: The term Common Risk Mitigation Mechanism (CRMM), sometimes seen in news, is associated to:
option1: accelerate the global solar power production
option2: prevent new disasters and reduce existing disaster risks
option3: ensure the safe use of cyberspace
option4: reduce tariffs as well as non-tariff barriers and foster international trade
answer: accelerate the global solar power production
explanation:
One of the stated objectives of Paris Agreement of 2015 was making finance flows consistent towards low greenhouse gas emissions and climate-resistant development. To achieve the same, recently in May, 2017, 16 countries of International Solar Alliance jointly commissioned to define and structure the Common Risk Mitigation Mechanism for solar power generation projects. The instrument aims to:
  • set up a secure environment for private investors to invest in solar projects
  • lower the cost of finance for renewable energy and the overall price of electricity enlarge the total size of the renewable energy market by making investments in renewables
  • diversify and pool risks on mutualised public resources and unlock significant investments
